analysis.Summary: Vue 3 SFC that renders a modal alert dialog using a Popup component. It displays a title, message, and a dynamic list of action buttons, and handles close and action callbacks via props.
analysis.Purpose: Provide a reusable alert dialog block in the UI where callers can pass in state (title, message, visibility, actions) and callbacks for button clicks and closing the dialog.

Components.name: Popup
Components.responsibility: Wrapper modal component that handles overlay, positioning and emits a close event.

Functions.name: handleAction

params.name: action
params.description: One of the entries from alertState.actions, expected to have at least a `label` and any action-specific payload.

Functions.description: Invoked when a user clicks one of the action buttons. Delegates action handling to the parent context.

Functions.name: closeAlert
Functions.description: Called when the Popup requests to close (via @close-popup). Delegates dialog closing to the parent context.

analysis.Usage: Imported into higher-level views or a global alert manager. Typically used as `<AlertDialog :alertState="state" :handleAction="onAction" :closeAlert="onClose" />` wherever an alert needs to be shown.
Notes: No local `<style>` blockâ€”relies on global utility CSS classes (widths, padding, radius).
alertState is passed by reference via `toRefs` to maintain reactivity.
Actions array is rendered with `v-for` and index as key, so ensure stable ordering or provide unique keys if order changes.
Popup component must support `title`, `isPopupOpen` props and `close-popup` event for proper behavior.
